{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3451242,"name":null,"username":"jolix","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-11-23T20:16:59.671Z","cooked":"

Swerve modules are spinning uncontrollably, they appear fine on Phoenix Tuner and the CAN is fine. All the LEDs are blinking green. When just driving forward, the swerves rotate as well. When you rotate, the swerves rotate uncontrollably.

sounds like it could be a PID tuning issue, do you have a way to verify the target module states are correct? then you can know if theres a code error thats commanding them incorrectly or if they are jittering around their target

The same pid values worked before, it just stopped working when we used parts of this drive base on another robot and then rebuilt this drive base

interesting, so you disassembled and reassembled the drive base? is it possible you swapped some turn and drive motors?

We checked all sparkmax ids and they were right. DriveStation says Cancoder error, but the cancoders seem fine in phoenix tuner and we traced all the wiring and found no issue.

Something is off with the encoder for the swerve, but we can’t find the issue

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-11-23T21:57:28.821Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":109,"readers_count":108,"score":31.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":475495,"topic_slug":"swerve-modules-spinning-uncontrollably","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":61239,"username":"AvocadoPeel","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/avocadopeel/{size}/232401_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69263,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-modules-spinning-uncontrollably/475495/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3451266,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-11-23T22:04:43.472Z","cooked":"

Take a look

Likely something is inverted and you are running in the wrong direction to a setpoint you will never reach.

Swerve Drive Debugging Flow Charts (YAGSL and others) Programming
I am working on creating swerve drive debugging flow charts to help people using YAGSL or any swerve program really. If your team has created some flowcharts, or wants to create flow charts to be added to the page please reply and I will credit you in the image note’s too! I haven’t made the swerve module wont spin correctly flowchart but describe what it will have in the page too. If i got something wrong in my flowcharts already please let me know and I will fix it! If you want to submit …

One thing you can do is use Phoenix X to read each cancoder’s position, then turn the wheel manually and reread the cancoder position ( did it increase or decrease approximately the amount you turned the wheel and in the correct direction). I’d also reverify zero is correct . One thing we’ve had issues with is if the magnet isn’t super glued properly, it sometimes works its way loose which can really mess with driving.
